Hi all.

I started using the GMAP few weeks ago and I am truly amazed with this wonder.

I have a question about polygons.I need to draw a circular area, starting from a given point (Lat, Long) and with a certain radius. 

I thought using a polygon, I found a code that calculates the points on the circle and then just draw the polygon. So far so good.

The visual aspect is ok, but the problem is I need to check if a bunch of points (markers) are or are not within the circular area of the polygon.

I noticed that when the mouse is within the area of the circle, does not always show the pointing hand, indicating that there are areas within the circle in which the property OnPolygonEnter and OnPolygonLeave are triggered in a wrong way. Of course, if the left mouse button is pressed when, within the circular area, but without the pointing hand shown, the event OnPolygonClick is not triggered.

In addition, the mouse movement outside the circular area of the polygon, triggers the events OnPolygonEnter and OnPolygonLeave. If I look on a point that is within one of these areas wrongly defined, regardless of whether inside or outside the circular area, I get wrong information about the position of the point.

I intend to make an application to determine epidemiological areas of coverage based on a point (basically a farm), and those areas are generally circular, formed from an epidemiological focus. It is crucial to be able to determine accurately the points (basically, other farms) that are within a certain area of contention.

There is already something about this matter or have someone encountered the same problem?

Can anyone give a help on this?

Thanks in advance and thank you so much for providing this excellent piece of software.

An outstanding work.

My code:

        Dim _Pol As clsPolygon = Nothing

        Dim _distance As Single = 2000

        _CenterXY = Me.MyMap.FromLatLngToLocal(_Center)

        Dim _radius As Single = _Pixels

        Dim _Points As New Generic.List(Of PointLatLng)

        For _k As Double = 0 To (2 * Math.PI) Step 0.01
            Dim _x As Double = Math.Sin(_k) * _radius + _CenterXY.X

            _Points.Add(Me.MyMap.FromLocalToLatLng(_x, _y))
            _Counter += 1

        _Pol = New clsPolygon(_Points, "Area")
        _Pol.IsHitTestVisible = True
        _Pol.Fill = New Drawing.SolidBrush(Drawing.Color.FromArgb(50, 0, 0, 255))

        _Pol.PenSelected = New Pen(Brushes.Yellow, 3)
        Me.MyOvAreas.Polygons.Add(_Pol)

I concluded that the problem only manifests itself in polygons with a considerable number of markers.
With only five or six markers the problem apparently does not exist.

I found an approach to solving the problem at http://greatmaps.codeplex.com/discussions/220983, but I get no events OnMarkerEnter, OnMarkerLeave and OnMarkerClick because of the size marker. 

I've tried to resize the marker but immediately lose his correct position on the overlay :-(

Can anyone help?

Public Class clsCircle
    Inherits GMap.NET.WindowsForms.GMapMarker
    Private MyMapControl As GMap.NET.WindowsForms.GMapControl = Nothing
    Private MyCentralPoint As GMap.NET.PointLatLng = Nothing

    Public Sub New(p As GMap.NET.PointLatLng, _MapControl As GMap.NET.WindowsForms.GMapControl)
        MyBase.New(p)
        Me.MyCentralPoint = p
        Me.MyMapControl = _MapControl
    End Sub
    Public Property [Radius] As Double = 0
    Public Property [Pen] As Pen = New Pen(Brushes.Orange, 2)
    Public Property [Brush] As Brush = New SolidBrush(Color.FromArgb(60, Me.Pen.Color))
    Public Property [Fill] As Boolean = True

    Public Overrides Sub OnRender(g As Graphics)
        Dim _Side As Integer = (Me.Radius / Me.MyMapControl.MapProvider.Projection.GetGroundResolution(Me.MyMapControl.Zoom, Position.Lat)) * 2
        Me.Size = New Size(_Side, _Side)
        Me.Offset = New Point(-_Side / 2, -_Side / 2)
        '---
        g.SmoothingMode = Drawing2D.SmoothingMode.AntiAlias
        Dim _rr As New Rectangle(Me.LocalPosition.X - (_Side / 2), Me.LocalPosition.Y - (_Side / 2), _Side, _Side)
        If Me.Fill = True Then
            g.FillEllipse(Me.Brush, _rr)
        End If
        'g.DrawRectangle(Me.Pen, _rr)
        g.DrawEllipse(Me.Pen, _rr)
        '---
    End Sub
End Class
